p.span: It was here that I first met Marquess Guo.
He saw my bare feet
and expressed his admiration
with quotations from the classics.
I flushed with shame, flustered
and exasperated by what he said.
I never imagined that in the future
he would become
the true love of my life.
And I would become
his entire world as well.
The love between Yunli and myself
has been a curing remedy in my life,
yet it also became the poison wine
which he willingly drank.
My lady,

div.p: Consort Li would like to meet with you.
Very well.

Eunuch Su, keep it secret.
Do not raise alarm.

Please rest easy.
I shall see to it.
One more thing,

Consort Li would like to eat
bitter almonds.

His Majesty has stated that
all of her needs shall be provided.
She remains Consort Li.
Huan, you have come.

Look at me.
Does my face show signs of aging?
Do I look the same as before?
Your face is unchanged.

Yet your heart is no longer
as simple as it once was.
If I had remained as artless as before,

I likely would have died
many times over in this harem.
Consort Hua was shrewd and overbearing.
The Empress is adept at intrigue.
I live in deep fear.
By night, I am set upon by nightmares.

Cruelty and humiliation
have made my life unbearable.

Everyone finds life in the harem
most difficult.
Yet no matter how difficult it becomes,

how much you must steel yourself
at each step,

you should not do harm
to those around you.

Especially those who have always
treated you as a sister.

Once I believed
your kindness was sincere.
Later I learned
that you treated me well,

always looked after me
and lent me a hand

only to have me vie with Shen Meizhuang
for the Emperor's favor.

All in order to consolidate
your own status within the palace.
Since we entered the palace,

we have depended on
one other for survival.

I would never force you to do
anything you were unwilling to do.
During the time of Mei's confinement,
if I had not been allied with you,

we would have faced
cruel oppression everywhere.
These bitter almonds are delicious.
After living in the palace for so long,
even bitter almonds taste sweet to me.

Do not bear grudges against me.
And do not say that I am vicious.
For after all,
it is you I hate the most
because you possess everything
while I have nothing.

I knew full well that the aid
the Empress offered me was insincere.
However, within the harem,
there is no such thing as sincerity.

Nights in the palace
were so cold and so long

that I shudder to think how I survived
every single second of those nights.
No matter how cold,

you should not warm yourself
with the blood of others.
I will not hate you.
Nor will I forgive you.
For you are not worthy of either.
Exactly.
My entire life
has been unworthy from the start.
Huan.
I am sorry.
My life,
my very breath,
has never been mine to command.
Today,
it is finally up to me
to choose my own fate.

My lady, why did you remain inside
for so long?
What did Consort Li say to you?
Nothing of importance.
She is truly pitiful.
Consort Li has passed away!
Hongli, it has been hot recently.
AISIN GIORO HONGLI

Your old maidservant says
that you study until midnight every night.

Profound study is good,
yet you must also care for your health.

Mother, you send me soup every night.
I haven't felt tired at all.

The bowl of soup is to remind you
that it is time for rest,

not to encourage
further studies afterwards.
Then I have misunderstood.

I greet Noble Consort Xi
and the Fourth Prince.

-The hour is late.
-Concubine Ning.
Why do you stand here alone?
I've come by the order of His Majesty.
However, the Third Prince is inside now.

Eunuch Su says His Majesty is in a rage.
He asked me to wait outside for a while.

By the way, Your Highness, I am told
you are quite assiduous in your studies.

Can you recite the classics
His Majesty mentioned just now?

How could I compare to the Third Brother?
I started schooling at a later age.

If I am assiduous,
it means I have much to learn.

That is why I spend much time on it.
Otherwise, my teachers will reprimand me.

Study this passage thoroughly
for three more days.

If you cannot interpret its meaning,
do not come to see me anymore.
AISIN GIORO HONGSHI

I greet Noble Consort Xi
and Concubine Ning.
You should go in now.
His Majesty was simply vexed.

It was inevitable that
he spoke so harshly.
Do not pay it heed.

After all, you two are father and son.
He will relent in a few days.
I understand.

The hour is late.
I must excuse myself.

Mother,
Third Brother studies quite hard.

I must study harder than he does.
Only then will Imperial Father like me.

You told Concubine Ning
you could not recite
the classics His Majesty mentioned.

Yet I overheard you
reciting them a few days ago.

You were able to interpret those passages
correctly and recite them fluently.

Mother, you never
call attention to yourself.

I take instruction from your example.
Of course I will do likewise.
You are quite astute.

We are family.
Of course I resemble you.

Has everything been properly arranged
for the Third Prince?

As you instructed, the Third Prince has
composed a poem as a gift for His Majesty.

Many days were spent preparing it.
His Majesty will surely be pleased.

On the late Emperor's birthday,
His Majesty
shows special reverence for his father.
He will definitely be moved easily.

The Third Prince
just needs to make an effort.

As the eldest son,
it's natural His Majesty
places high expectations in him.

I will persuade the high-ranking officials
to vouch for the Third Prince.

Hopefully, he will gain
recognition and support

so that His Majesty may select him
as Crown Prince with confidence.

With the aid of Your Highness,
everything will turn out well.
Doctor Wei, what's wrong with my lady?

She cannot hold down her food,
and her sleep is fitful at night.
What could be wrong?

I must send for Doctor Wen at once.
Perhaps he can save the unborn child.

How has Noble Consort Xi fared
these last two days?

The imperial doctor says
she suffers from a digestive disorder.
She is continually ill and weak.
During the morning audience at court,
Ortai debated Maci.
I listened to their discussion.

It concerned the selection of
Crown Prince.
Inside and outside the palace,

heaven knows how many people
have their eyes fixed on this throne.

Selecting the Crown Prince openly
will surely bring disorder.

I must devise a way
to be prepared for any contingency.
Your Majesty, you are right.
I am well aware
that though the harem
seems calm and tranquil outwardly,
it is in fact filled with depravity.
My real concern

is that the harem
and the state are linked
and entangled.

I must take precautions
and be well prepared.
My lady,

I believe Wei Lin has done
all that is possible.

-Unfortunately...
-What is it?

You have carried this child
only a short while,

yet you are in constant
agitation and depression.

You are still weakened
from the birth of the twins.

Now is not the time
for another child.
My lady, four months have passed already.
This child...

Even though Wei Lin and I may do
everything known to our medical art,

you will carry the child
no more than five months.

-Five months?
-Exactly.
Then the bond between us

will last no longer
than one more month?

My lady, your health
is of great importance.
You will conceive another child someday.
Tell no one
of what you know.

Help me to carry this child
as long as possible.
Besides that,

you must prepare
medication in advance
that will bring this to an end.
Perhaps at some point,
this child may yet do me a great favor.
I understand.

The officials of Qiongzhou
have sent us a large red coral in tribute.
It is truly rare.

Hinayana Buddhism regards red coral
as the reincarnation of Tathagata.

It would make the finest
protective charm for the child.
With such a precious coral,
it would be a pity to hide it away.

We must invite all the concubines
to Yongshou Palace to view it.
You may do as you wish.

It just so happens that
the priest of Baohua Temple

has made some amulets
to bless my unborn child.

The priest says it must be
those of highest rank in the harem

to place each amulet in a blessed pouch
and fasten it at my bedside.
Then the ritual will be completed.
The most suitable persons

are the Empress, Imperial Noble
Consort Duan and Noble Consort Jing.

I myself will fasten one of them.
That will complete the four corners.

It is an act that vouchsafes
great blessings, they will not refuse.
The Empress rarely comes out nowadays.

She has refused
all invitations from others.

However, if the Empress is absent,
the ritual will not be perfect.

If it is your wish,
I will issue the invitation personally.
Why has the Empress failed to arrive?

Could it be that the Empress
is displeased with me?
No, it can't be.

She is the Empress.
She is obliged to be magnanimous.
Her Highness the Empress!

Your Highness,
may blessings and peace be with you.

I greet Your Majesty.
May blessings and peace be with you.

-Please rise.
-Yes, Your Majesty.

Even in your illness, I asked you to come.
I have troubled you. Do you resent me?
How could I?

Your Majesty and myself
are joined as a couple.

How could I not be concerned
for Noble Consort Xi?
The Empress is most virtuous.
Your Highness,

the priest says these amulets and
blessed pouches are auspicious tokens.

They can secure peace and good health
for my unborn child.

But I must trouble Your Highness
and two high-ranking concubines
to place each amulet in a blessed pouch
and then fasten them at my bedside.

It is no trouble.
It is our pleasure.

Your Majesty,
Noble Consort Xi is carrying a child.

Naturally, the tutelary god
is guarding over her bedchamber.
I bring my illness.

Moreover, a stranger may offend the god
by entering the bedchamber. It is unwise.

Imperial Noble Consort Duan
and Noble Consort Jing

do not mind performing
this modest task.

Why do you try to avoid it
with so many excuses?

As head of the harem, you should be
responsible for maintaining harmony

and set an example
for all the concubines.
Yes, Your Majesty.

We servants are too lowly
to touch these auspicious items.

Therefore, we shall not enter
my lady's bedchamber with you
lest we offend the gods.
It would not be wise.

You are right. We must be especially
cautious with regard to such matters.
I will carry them.

My lady, you have not taken
your medicinal tonic yet.

You said it was too hot
when it was sent to you earlier.
Now it is merely warm.

If you don't take it now,
it will cool down.

The Empress is truly exemplary
when she reveals her virtuous nature.
She has always disliked Noble Consort Xi.

Nonetheless, she now yields to her
for the greater good.
Do not speak ill of the Empress.

I am grateful to Your Highness
for fulfilling my wish,

for agreeing to fasten
this blessed pouch for me.

I am the Empress.
I am obliged to do so.
You are bound by custom to do so.

But inwardly, Your Highness
must hate me to the core.

I hope you can maintain your composure
and not lose yourself in distractions.

Your first priority now should be
the birth of His Majesty's child.

Whether the child will be born or not
depends entirely on the Empress, not me.

Impudence!
How dare you slander me!
Slander?
Let go.

Will you swear upon the gods that
you have never harmed any imperial heirs,

that you have never harmed
any of the concubines, including myself?

I am head of the harem.
How could I swear vows by your command?
Why did Consort Qi die?

Why did Concubine Ning
become barren?
Lady Fucha miscarried
and I lost my own child.

So many shameful things,
all originating with you.

-How did it happen?
-What's wrong with my lady?
My lady.
What happened to my lady?
My lady, what's the matter?
Help! My lady!

-Huan Huan.
-Your Majesty, she has fainted.
Summon the doctor.

-Go quickly.
-Imperial doctor!
Noble Consort Xi, you are awake.

Noble Consort Xi,
please contain your grief.
You will conceive another child someday.
"I will conceive another child someday"?
You say that so plainly.

Was the life of my child
so insignificant?
Your Highness,
no matter how great your hatred for me,
why did you have to harm my child?

Preposterous!
When did I harm your child?
Your Majesty.
I have lost my child.
It was not caused by my carelessness.
It was Her Highness the Empress.
She and I came into conflict.
Then she pushed me.

Your Majesty, her abdomen indeed
shows signs of a heavy blow.
Any imperial doctor can verify this.

She had to be pushed
forcefully by someone.

Besides, her unborn child
had been of sound health.

It is probable that Your Majesty
has even felt the child move.

If not for an accident,
she would not have miscarried.
Empress,

only you and Noble Consort Xi
were in the bedchamber at that time.
Your Majesty.

There are many witnesses here,
including myself.

As Noble Consort Xi lay injured and prone,
the Empress was the only person near her.
Your Majesty.

The Empress has long begrudged me
the favor shown to me.

She has always felt I disrespected her.
So she scolded me.
In a fit of rage, she pushed me.

At that moment, Noble Consort Xi
grew desperate and dared grasp my hand.

I struggled vigorously to shake her grip.
But I never pushed Noble Consort Xi.
Empress, from what you have said,

you mean that it was Noble Consort Xi
who tossed herself to the ground?

You have said that Noble Consort Xi
became desperate,
then how on earth did she offend you?

Only Noble Consort Xi and I
were inside the bedchamber.
There's nothing I can say on that account.
But if it appears I had some role in this,

it is because someone
has arranged things to appear that way.
You claim there's nothing you can say.

But there's nothing I can say
to explain how this happened either.

You have always disliked Noble Consort Xi.
I know that full well.

Yet Noble Consort Xi has always shown
deference to you to maintain harmony.

Your Majesty, there is no reason
for me to harm Noble Consort Xi.

I swear upon my ancestors
of the Ula Nara clan.

I have done nothing to harm
the unborn child of Noble Consort Xi!
You would do better to swear it again

before the memorial of
the Empress Dowager.

The Empress is vicious
and has harmed an imperial heir.
Henceforward,
she will be confined to Jingren Palace.

-Su Peisheng.
-Your Majesty.

-Take her away.
-Yes, sir.
Your Highness, please come with me.

Mother, I know you are grieved
at the death of my unborn brother.

I transcribed some prayer flags
and burned them for my little brother.
I hope he may find peace.
You are truly dutiful to family.
How fares the Third Prince?

The Third Prince and the Empress
are as closely united as hand in glove.
Naturally, with the Empress present,

the Third Prince is likely
to win the throne.

And with the Third Prince present,
the Empress has one more ally.
Yes, I understand.

Fourth Brother, you are always studying.
How are you at leisure today?
It is our Eighth Uncle's birthday.

I visited him at the prison
of the Imperial Clan Court.

You dared to visit our Eighth Uncle?
Were you not afraid of being seen?
Of course I concealed it from others.

But I dare not hide it
from my own brother.
How fares our Eighth Uncle?

How else? His title was revoked and
he is imprisoned in unbearable conditions.

Third Brother,
I wish to tell you something,
but I don't know if it is appropriate.

We are brothers.
We can dispense with formalities.

Our father imprisoned
several clan relatives
due to struggles over the throne.

The Eighth Uncle and the 14th Uncle
are both brothers to our Imperial Father.

If we intercede for them and thus allow
our Imperial Father to forgive them,
not only will his reputation be cemented,

sparing him condemnation as a fratricide
for hundreds of years,

but it will also allow
the Empress Dowager to rest in peace.

The late Emperor's birthday
is next month.
If the opportunity arises,

I plan to beg our father to forgive
the Eighth Uncle and the 14th Uncle.

It will also show
deep filial piety towards
the late Emperor and the Empress Dowager.

Brother, you have given
much thought to this.
It had not even occurred to me.

Very well.
If the opportunity arises on that day,

I will ask our father to show mercy
and try to convince him.
Good.
Your Highness, bad news!

The Third Prince has been removed
from the imperial lineage
and renamed son of the Eighth Lord.
What are you talking about?

The Imperial Clan Court
has already received the decree.
Nonsense!

The Third Prince is His Majesty's own son.
How can it be?
I dare not lie.

The Third Prince interceded for the
14th Lord,
the Eighth Lord and yourself.

His Majesty berated him
for his disloyalty.

Everything was going well.
Why did he intercede for those offenders?

All the painstaking effort I have spent
over so many years was in vain.
It was all in vain!
You must devise a way to save the Prince.
Useless fool!
His Majesty has always been ruthless.

And now, the ties between
father and son have broken.

Your Highness, if the Third Prince
cannot be selected as Crown Prince...

Without the Third Prince, he still has
the Fourth Prince and the Fifth Prince.

In the worst case, the Sixth Prince
may be chosen as well.
The Sixth Prince?

Just as took place
after Consort Qi died.
Without Zhen Huan,
I could raise the Sixth Prince.
As long as I remain the Empress,

as long as a chance remains
for me to reestablish myself,
it doesn't matter whose child he is.
As long as I am appointed his mother,
I will be the one true Empress Dowager.

-Have you prepared what I asked for?
-It is ready now.

The Empress knows nothing of it.
Should we report it to her?

A master disgraced
while her servants do nothing!

I have served the Empress for years.
Never has she suffered such humiliation.

The Empress herself, framed by a lowly
concubine and confined to her palace.

The Empress's hopes
for the Third Prince are dashed as well.
It is utterly intolerable.
Give it to me.
Yunli.

The birthday celebration for
our late Imperial Father is now finished.

Whenever I recall the times
when our Imperial Father lived

and the guidance
he gave the both of us,
I have always felt sorrowful.
But were our father here today,

were he to see you married
and expecting a child so soon,
MENG JINGXIAN
he would truly be gratified.

Everything I have
was given by Your Majesty's grace.
Your little cousin is within my belly.

-Sixth Prince, do you like him?
-I want a girl cousin.
My lord, what do you think?
Very well.
Hongyan, come to your mother for soup.

Don't bother
Secondary Princess Consort Xian.
I want Auntie to feed me.
Fine. I will feed you, good boy.

Hongyan is still young,
yet he likes Xian's baby very much.

It appears they have been
brought together by fate.

They are cousins,
of course they are together by fate.
Jingxian.
Jingxian, what's the matter? Jingxian!
Imperial doctor!

What happened?
She was well just a moment ago.
It appears she has been poisoned.

The food is poisoned!
Imperial guards, protect His Majesty!

Your Majesty, if Xian has been poisoned,
you'd best return to Yangxin Hall at once.

-Your Majesty.
-I shall not leave.

I must stay to discover
who could be so audacious

as to carry out an assassination
in my presence.
It is crane's red crown.
Crane's red crown?

That's not good.
The child is already mature.

Quickly, prepare the medicine
to hasten delivery.

-My lord.
-Go! Hurry up!

Your Majesty, Secondary Princess
Consort Xian has been poisoned.
What was the last thing she ate?
Your Majesty,

Secondary Princess Consort Xian
tasted the Sixth Prince's soup.

The silver needle has turned black.
This bowl of soup is poisonous.
Check this one as well.
This one is poisonous as well.

Your Majesty, someone intended
to kill Hongyan and myself.
Xian was simply caught in between.
Investigate at once!
Yes, Your Majesty.
My lord.
My lord.
It was I who plied you with drink.
That is how our child was conceived.
Do not speak of it now.
I am by your side.
I will always remain by your side.

The maid who served the soup
to Noble Consort Xi and the Sixth Prince

states that on her way she crossed paths
with Jianqiu of Jingren Palace.

Jianqiu opened the lid of the food box
and asked what was inside.
Aside from her, no other is suspicious.
I have brought Jianqiu here.

-Bring her here.
-Yes, Your Majesty.
Was it the Empress?

The Empress remains confined.
She knew nothing of this.
I planned it on my own.
She is going to commit suicide.

Your Majesty, why didn't you trust
Her Highness the Empress?

She is your wife.
She has truly loved you.

Take her to the Office of Punishment
for interrogation by torture.
She must be forced to tell the truth.
Take her away!

Noble Consort Xi, aren't you afraid
of being punished in the end?
Fate will bring you to a miserable end!

Noble Consort Xi,
you are a vile wretch!
Your Majesty, it is a baby boy.

Yet Secondary Princess Consort Xian
was so weakened by her labor

that she was unable to endure
the poison and has expired.
All has been confessed.

In addition to the plot on Noble
Consort Xi,
much more was revealed.
I dare not hide it from Your Majesty.
What is it?

Your Majesty, it concerns the cause
of Empress Chunyuan's death.
It is linked to the Empress.
Impudence!
I dare not lie.
Speak. Spare me no detail.

Your Majesty,
I have consulted the imperial doctors.

They say the plantain is of cold nature.
Normally, eating a little causes no harm.

But a woman who carries a child
should not consume any.

Because the plantain has the same effect
as peach stone and safflower,

it can unblock the blood
and relieve swelling.
The effect is not as strong as safflower.

Yet if steamed together with other foods,
its properties may infiltrate that food.

After many exposures,
it may be harmful to health.

Besides, an ingredient
of the almond milk tea

was also replaced by peach stone,
which is harmful to the fetus.

Since it was blended into the tea,
it was difficult to recognize by taste.
All of these ingredients

had always been slipped into the food
of Empress Chunyuan.

Did the servants admit this
with their own mouths?

Jianqiu was mercilessly tortured,
yet she didn't say a word.

However, Jiang Fuhai
has confessed to everything.

At such a juncture,
do you admit your own guilt?

Your Majesty,
since you already believe it is so,
why bother to ask?

Were I not obliged to hear
your confession myself

do you think I would willingly
look upon your face?

This pair of jade bracelets
was given to me when I married you.
You personally placed them on my wrists.
At the time,

you took this bracelet in hand
and told me

if I should someday
give birth to a son,

I would become
your primary spouse.
Yet when I did give birth to a son,

you had already married my sister
as your primary spouse.

Even my son was forced to accept
the rank of a concubine's son.
Just as I did,

he endured scorn
as the child of a concubine.
How could you truly understand

how hard it is to be
the child of a concubine?
It is precisely because I understood

that I have treated you well
since we married.

Even though Chunyuan
was my only primary spouse,

I made you my secondary spouse,
second only to her.
Chunyuan was your own sister.

Were you not afraid
of the consequences?
During the nighttime,

had you no fear that
Chunyuan and her child
would haunt you and claim your life?

If she wanted to claim my life,
she could have just come for me.
But during the long nights,

the incessant crying of my own child
haunted my dreams.

At the moment I lost my own child,
my sister learned that she was expecting.

Your Majesty, you were overjoyed
by my sister's pregnancy

and had already forgotten
our own child.
He was less than three years old.
His body was scalding hot with fever.
He died from an incurable illness.

Unexpectedly, my sister conceived
at the very same time.

Was it not her son
that claimed my son's life?

How could I allow her son
to become the Crown Prince?
What madness.

It was I who insisted on
marrying Chunyuan.

It was I who took her
as my primary spouse.
It was I who conceived a child with her.
Why did you not hate me instead?
You think I didn't want to hate you?
But I could not.
I truly could not.
You only cared for my sister.
Your Majesty, did you ever know

that my love for you was no less
than your love for my sister?

Every woman
who truly loves her husband

could never bear to watch
her beloved husband

fall in love and have a child
with another woman.
I cannot bear it.
I truly cannot bear it.

Though you think
I am spiteful and jealous,
I am the one who has loved you most truly.
That is why I have acted in this way.
Honeyed words but evil intent.
You truly disgust me.

The Empress,
descended from the Ula Nara clan,

has not been blessed by heaven,
and is utterly deceitful.

She harmed imperial heirs
and conspired with imperial officials.
She is unsuitable to be a member of the

royal family,
a model mother to the nation.

Thus, she will be demoted
to the status of a commoner
and sent to the Cold Palace.

-Su Peisheng.
-Your Majesty.
Announce my decree to the harem.
She and I

shall never meet again
in this lifetime nor in death.
Yes, Your Majesty.

p.span: Your Majesty,

div.p:
Moge Khan of the Dzungar Mongols
is overweening and ambitious.

He is moving towards Yanming Pass
with a cavalry of 400,000.

Once Yanming Pass
is occupied by the enemy,

the capital will be placed
in a critical situation.

The Dzungar Mongols are nothing more
than a tribe of the steppes.
Even they dare to challenge me now.

If we must appoint another
capable general at this moment,
it will probably prove quite difficult.

It is easier to raise an army of thousands
than it is to find one good general.

For a leader to send to the battlefront,
the Imperial Dukes are the best choice.
After careful consideration,

I believe Marquess Guo
is the best choice.

Marquess Guo
has always known his place.

Your Majesty, you have considered
every detail. Most admirable.
He is fond of poetry and literature.

It matters not if I promote him to duke
and grant him undeserved recognition.

It is the skilled generals
that must be chosen with care.
I understand.

Once the situation at the battlefront
becomes somewhat stable,

we shall send him
to guard Yanming Pass.
Yes, Your Majesty.

Flowers in blossom and the full moon,
symbols of a conjugal bliss which endures.

Flowers in blossom and the full moon
are easy to attain.

Yet lovers' moments together
do not endure.

p.span: Huan, at this very moment,
I hope you are enjoying peace
and happiness beneath this moonlight.

div.p: Are these letters authentic?

Have you confirmed
that the handwriting is his?
Yes, I have.

When I greeted
Secondary Princess Consort Yu,

I took them from the lowest drawer
of her dressing table.
Are they all here?

I was afraid they would be
noticed missing.
Thus, I only took a few.
How fares Duke Guo?

Your Majesty, Duke Guo has guarded
